lead_paragraph: The Black Coaches and Administrators released its fourth hiring report card yesterday, and it came with a warning: Add more diversity to the head-coaching ranks or risk facing a future civil-rights lawsuit. The report showed that of 197 head-coaching vacancies since 1996, only 12 went to black coaches, and only 26 blacks had been hired at Football Bowl Subdivision colleges. This season began with 12 coaches who are members of minority groups at the 220 universities in the F.B.S. and Football Championship Subdivision that play football and are not historically black colleges or universities.
